Image2Characters.rekkariDetectionSave.DetectPlate¶

class Image2Characters.rekkariDetectionSave.DetectPlate(trainedHaarFileName='rekkari.xml', npImage=None, imageFileName=None, detectFactor=5, scaleFactor=1.03, minSize=(5, 18), colorConversion=6, imageXfactor=None, imageYfactor=None)[source]¶

Returns rectangles containing possible licence plates from a given image for parameters see http://docs.opencv.org/3.0-beta/modules/objdetect/doc/cascade_classification.html

python3 rekkariDetectionSave.py 0-751.jpg (there must be trained classifiier file, assumption is ‘rekkari.xml’ )

__init__(trainedHaarFileName='rekkari.xml', npImage=None, imageFileName=None, detectFactor=5, scaleFactor=1.03, minSize=(5, 18), colorConversion=6, imageXfactor=None, imageYfactor=None)[source]¶

Methods

__init__([trainedHaarFileName, npImage, ...])
getGray()
getNpPlates() give found plate(s) as array of numpy arrays
getRotationAnglesCenters([minAng, maxAng]) rotate image so that we get weighted maximum of sum over x-sum-values of the plate
get_rotation_angles()
get_rotation_centers()
image2PlateNumpyArrays([rotate]) if rotate is true, try to make plates horizontal
image2Plates() from image, produce rectangle(s) that contain possible plate, output as list of rectanges
rotatePlate(rectangle[, minAng, maxAng]) rotate single plate to make letters and digits horizontal
showPlates([rotate]) show plates
writePlates([name]) debugging: write each plate to a separate file
